p: All of these tests have their particularities and have positive points as well as negative points. Nanotechnology through its numerous applications is an efficient and cost-effective tool to be used to improve these tests for detection of SARS-CoV-2 [ 106]. A variety of nanomaterials, including metallic nanoparticles, polymeric nanoparticles, silica nanoparticles, carbon nanotubes, and quantum dots, are already used for virus detection [ 105, 110]. For the development of these systems for virus detection, the surface of the nanoparticle was modified with biomolecules derived from the virus, for example DNA, RNA, antibody, antigen (hemagglutinin antigen H1N1), peptide or pentabody (avian influenza virusâ€“pVHH3B) [ 105, 110]. The high surface and volume ratios of nanomaterials improve the interactions between the sensor and the analyte, increasing the detection limit and decreasing the detection time [ 111].
